author: Prakash Kamat
text:
Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) personnel and a bomb disposal squad of the Goa Police searched an Air India flight from Delhi on Sunday afternoon following a bomb threat.

The Goa police said after a phone call claimed there was a bomb onboard, a thorough inspection of the Air India Flight AI-156 from Delhi to Goa to Moscow was conducted.

“A person who identified himself as Videsh Singh called the Calangute police station in north coastal Goa Sunday morning saying that he was informed by someone named 'Rajan' that there was a bomb onboard AI-156, which was due to land in Goa at 2 pm,” a senior police official said requesting anonymity.

The call turned out to be a hoax as security personnel did not find any explosives on the plane carrying 89 passengers including four foreign nationals, police later said.
title: Bomb hoax on Air India flight
